Html:
In Javascript you can add functions and other types of members to objects by adding them to the prototype.

The adding of functions (even accessor properties) to objects could be simplified in TypeScript with a language extension similar to Extension methods in C#. Pro is that you don't need to write weak code to extend types.

Extension methods could be stored in modules and available as they are imported.
